result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrett M Kirchen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Buy money of $195 to be paid during period of probation, payable back to Ozaukee County.  Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jarrett M Kirchen in court with attorney Wilfred P de Junco.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea of guilty.  Court accepts plea, finds the defendant guilty and renders sentence.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
